content.description: My favorite route on the wall. Start to the right of The Dirt Monster on the blank face right of the crack. The crack to the left is off and the right arete is off as well. If you use the right arete it’s more like 5.8. Awesome movement with lots of high feet using cool shaped side pulls.
content.location: Right side of Booze Wall to the right of the middle crack.

content.description: Straight up the middle of the prized face of Booze Wall. Crack on the right is off. If you start to trail left without using the arete, it’s like a 5.9 variation. Get the most of this route by trying to go directly up the middle of the blankest part of the face. The crux is a mantle onto a small juggy seam about 12 feet up.
Start on the very left side of the cliff and follow the arete to the top.

Go straight up the crack in the middle of Booze Wall. The route sort of merges with Witches Brew and The Wolfman near the final 10 feet due to the shape of the Cliff. Routes namesake is the massive ball of dirt that obstructs the start. If you fall near the start you may become a victim of the dirt monster.
content.location: Crack in the middle of Booze Wall

content.description: It's an ok climb if you are up at the booze walls you might as well do it it's quick and easy. It can be used as well as some easy scrambling to access the top of Ain't No Rest for the wicked.
content.protection: Double tree at the top for anchor.i small hand-finger size cams fit well and a set of nuts.
content.location: Left side around the corner you will see a dihedral with 2 cracks in it climb this to the double trees.

climbs.name: Ain't No Rest For The Wicked

content.description: It is a sustained climb with very few breaks from hard move after hard move, Hence the name.
content.protection: You can use the trees at the top and or trad gear to build a TR anchor. Leading Trad is possible but expect long run outs.
content.location: You will see a fallen tree with a root ball sticking out of the ground the beginning of the route starts to the left of that root ball. It is a must-do if you are climbing in the area.

content.description: 40 cliff with some great climbs. Features very high quality slab climbs on great quality rock. Named Booze wall for the unfortunate amount of beer/liquor bottles at the bottom of the cliff (soon to be cleaned up).
